clinical_study.brief_title: Intra-arterial Prostaglandin Therapy in Non-occlusive Mesenteric Ischemia
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of an Intra-arterial Prostaglandin Therapy in Non-occlusive Mesenteric Ischemia (NOMI)

brief_summary.textblock: Minimal invasive intra-arterial prostaglandin therapy is currently being offered as an established and safe treatment approach for Non-occlusive mesenteric ischemia (NOMI). So far, there are no data that prospective evaluate clinical response parameters of this method and corresponding criteria for response. The investigators are therefore planning a prospective observational study on NOMI patients with the aim of describing the clinical development and parameters of intestinal micro- and macrocirculation under intra-arterial prostaglandin therapy. From this description, the investigators hope to subsequentially derive clinical criteria to better predict response to therapy.

arm_group.description: Minimal invasive Cannulation of the Superior Mesenteric Artery (SMA) and subsequent intra-arterial application of prostaglandin E1 (Initial Bolus 20ug, followed by continuous Infusion of 60-80ug/24hr for 24-72hrs)

intervention.description: Minimal invasive Cannulation of the Superior Mesenteric Artery (SMA) and subsequent intra-arterial application of prostaglandin E1 (Initial Bolus 20ug, followed by continuous Infusion of 60-80ug/24hr for 24-72hrs)

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to the ICU with persistent shock, intestinal failure as well as new onset and progressive organ failure with a CT and angiography based diagnosis of Non-occlusive mesenteric ischemia (NOMI)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- persistent shock: Norepinephrine dose > 0.2ug/kg/min over > 48hrs
- intestinal failure: paralytic ileus > 24hrs despite neostigmine therapy
- new onset progressive organ failure (2 out of six criteria): Norepinephrine dose increase, rise in serum lactate, decrease in Horowitz index, new renal replacement therapy, rise in bilirubin, rise in INR, or all of the following: rise in ALT, AST, CK and LDH
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients < 18 years old
- pregnancy
